chapter_title: FIVE MORE WAYS IN WHICH YOU CAN DEMONSTRATE TO YOUR BOSS THAT YOU HAVE YOUR SHIT TOGETHER
summary: In this chapter, Sarah Knight emphasizes the importance of clarity in career advancement. She encourages readers to take initiative by directly asking their bosses for clear expectations related to promotions and raises. By doing so, employees can focus their efforts on meeting specific goals rather than waiting for hints. Knight also highlights five practical ways to show professionalism and capability, from following instructions to owning up to mistakes. Ultimately, this proactive approach reveals opportunities for growth and advancement, while also demonstrating readiness for new challenges.

slides.section_body: Don’t leave your career advancement to chance! Directly ask your boss for specific goals that will help you earn promotions. This proactive approach allows you to focus your efforts efficiently. By knowing exactly what’s expected, you can demonstrate your commitment to your role and the organization.
slides.quote: Take the mystery out of your career path by asking for a clear strategy.

slides.section_body: It's crucial to understand if there's potential for advancement in your role. If your boss dodges your inquiries about promotion pathways, it might be a sign that such opportunities are limited. Don't hesitate to ask; this clarity can save you from stagnation in your career.
slides.quote: Sometimes, the only thing holding you back is the lack of clear communication.

slides.section_body: One simple yet powerful way to showcase your professionalism is by closely following instructions. It reflects your ability to listen and implement feedback effectively. Consistently adhering to guidelines can set you apart as a reliable and competent employee.
slides.quote: Diligence and adherence to instructions can go a long way in your professional journey.

slides.section_body: Mistakes are inevitable, but owning up to them shows strength and integrity. Acknowledging your errors and learning from them is a mark of true professionalism. This honesty reinforces trust with your boss and colleagues, which is invaluable in any workspace.
slides.quote: Owning your mistakes is part of the journey to success.

slides.section_body: Taking initiative is essential to presenting yourself as someone who has their act together. Show your boss that you’re always looking for ways to improve and contribute more. Proactivity can lead to recognition and open doors to new opportunities.
slides.quote: Be proactive and take charge of your responsibilities and aspirations.

slides.section_body: Don’t shy away from showcasing your accomplishments. Whether it’s a project you led or a skill you mastered, make sure it’s visible. Displaying this book on your desk can be a great conversation starter about your journey towards self-improvement.
slides.quote: Let your workspace inspire conversations about your dedication and achievements.

slides.section_body: Professional environments thrive on collaboration and positivity. Avoid behaviors that can alienate your colleagues or boss. Strive to be approachable and supportive; this will reflect positively on your professional demeanor.
slides.quote: Being a pleasure to work with can significantly enhance your career trajectory.

slides.section_body: Regularly seeking feedback not only shows your willingness to learn but also keeps you informed of your standing. Constructive criticism is invaluable for growth and progression. Don’t wait for formal reviews; make it a habit.
slides.quote: Feedback is a gift, and seeking it shows ambition and commitment.

slides.section_body: If your boss is unwilling to provide growth opportunities, that could be a sign to explore other options. Recognizing when it’s time to look for a new job is an important part of having your sh_t together. Your skills and determination will help you find a role that values your contributions.
slides.quote: Sometimes, moving on is the best way to continue your professional growth.

slides.section_body: Confidence is key! Knowing your worth and potential can propel you toward success. Trust in your abilities and the unique contributions you offer. This mindset will help you navigate challenges and elevate your career.
slides.quote: Believe in yourself and the path you are creating.
